intro: Clidemia rubra var. ursina, commonly known as the red mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, clustered white to pinkish flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptical, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Clidemia rubra var. ursina is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is known for its ornamental value in horticulture.
